title: Drummond Ford
text:
Lieutenant Commander Drummond St Clair Ford (16 December 1907 – 12 December 1942) was a Scottish international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player, who was killed in <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>.
He was capped five times for between 1930 and 1932, scoring three tries in that period. He also played for <a href="United%20Services%20Portsmouth%20Rugby%20Football%20Club">United Services Portsmouth Rugby Football Club</a> and <a href="Royal%20Navy%20Rugby%20Union">Royal Navy Rugby Union</a>.
